page.title: 06Trade in Great Orton
page.content: The village has just one shop built in 1960. Previous shops were usually found in local cottages. The present shop combines Post Office, butcher and grocer. It is a family concern. The Post Office section deals with stamp sales, pensions, savings bank, TV and radio licences. Meat packs for the deep freeze form part of the butchery business. Fresh meat is chosen and bought by the butcher at local auctions. Sausage, pies and pasties are made on the premises. All kinds of grocery goods are sold as well as some fruit and vegetables. Travelling shops, such as the baker & fishmonger visit the village weekly. There is one public house the Wellington Inn and reputed to have its own ghost. Some years ago a pathway subsided and an old well was discovered, possibly Roman.The blacksmith's is now a garage
